summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs News Briefing from May 26, 2021, covering a wide range of national and international news. It includes a brief update on the Epstein case, noting that a judge approved a deal allowing two jail guards to avoid prison for falsifying records the night Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide. The briefing primarily focuses on other topics including police reform, Capitol violence investigations, COVID-19, and foreign policy.

events.title: Judge Approves Deal for Epstein's Jail Guards
events.description: US District Judge Analisa Torres approved a deferred prosecution agreement for jail guards Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, allowing them to avoid prison for falsifying records on the night Jeffrey Epstein killed himself.

keyFacts: A judge approved a deferred prosecution agreement for two jail guards, Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, related to the night Jeffrey Epstein died.
The guards admitted to falsifying records and will avoid prison, instead serving six months of supervised release and 100 hours of community service.
